summary: UI wiring for new branding assets was added (App header uses hero background + logo image; index.html favicon link updated), but the actual required image files are not present in the diff. Additionally, global theme/token changes were introduced that were not requested and may conflict with the requirement to keep existing Tailwind theme tokens/palette stable.

missing_requirements.requirement: Generate original branding images for AI Logic (logo 512x512, favicon 32x32, hero 1600x400) with a modern minimal aesthetic and clearly original visuals.
missing_requirements.reason: No image assets were added/modified in the diff; there is no evidence the required PNG files were generated or included.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the generated branding images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated with exact filenames; replace header Bot icon with logo; add favicon link in HTML head; no backend changes.
missing_requirements.reason: Header/logo and favicon references appear implemented, but the required static files under frontend/public/assets/generated are not present in the diff (no added files).

hallucinated_features.description: Global theme/palette changes (new warm amber/orange OKLCH palette and Tailwind token/font configuration changes).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asked to keep branding consistent with existing Tailwind tokens and avoid shifting to a new blue/purple-dominant palette; it did not request changing global theme tokens/palette or Tailwind config. These changes also risk violating REQ-3â€™s requirement to continue using existing tokens without global theme shifts.
evidence: frontend/src/index.css (per frontend-file-summaries.txt: "Global styles with a warm amber/orange OKLCH color palette...")

hallucinated_features.description: Addition of deployment URL UI/config and domain validation utilities (AppLinkSection, deployConfig, domainValidation, .env.example).
hallucinated_features.reason: Explicit non-goals include implementing new chat features and making unrelated product changes; the BuildRequest is focused on branding images and UI rendering only. These features are not requested in REQ-1..REQ-3.
